page.title: 16Twining Brothers Shop Oxford
page.content: We interviewed Mr Twining.He has lived in Summertown all his life.His father and his uncle owned a chain of shops in Oxford.The shop,Twining Brothers,was opposite South Parade where the cycle shop is now.It was a grocer's shop and was also a great place for gossip. It was open from 8am-6pm Monday to Wednesday.Thursday was a half day,on Friday and Saturday it closed at 8pm and it was closed on Sundays. They sold biscuits,soap,vegetables and even wine and spirits.Tea and sugar came in large sacks and was weighed into bags. Boys delivered orders around the area on their push bikes,(later on they had a van). The shop closed down in 1966 because it was old fashioned and it could not compete with the supermarkets.
